ativijjha.sutta_1: tenāhaṃ etarahi kāyena ca phusitvā viharāmi, paññāya ca ativijjha passāmī’ti.
ativijjha.example_1: But now I have direct meditative experience of them, and see them with penetrating wisdom.’

niccharatī.example_1: yet your mind strays to outward things.
niccharatī.comment: pr. wanders; roams; lit. goes out

supinena.example_1:
uṭṭhehi bhikkhu kiṃ sesi,
ko attho supitena [supinena] te,
āturassa hi kā niddā,
sallaviddhassa ruppato.

saṇṭhāne.comment: meeting hall, assemlby place, lit. standing together

tūriyatāḷitavāditanigghosasaddaṃ.sutta_1: atha kho so bhikkhu vesāliyā tūriyatāḷitavāditanigghosasaddaṃ sutvā paridevamāno tāyaṃ velāyaṃ imaṃ gāthaṃ abhāsi:
tūriyatāḷitavāditanigghosasaddaṃ.example_1: Then that mendicant, complaining at the noise of musical instruments being beaten and played, on that occasion spoke this verse:
